item.title: ‘If they see us they will bomb us’ - watch as BBC reaches a hidden war’s jungle front line
item.description: The BBC spends a month inside Myanmar, where young medics, teachers and fighters are powering the revolution against the ruling military junta.

item.title: Party leaders hit the road to make their pitches to voters
item.description: Rishi Sunak promises financial stability while Keir Starmer says a vote for him is vote for change.

item.title: Smoking ban bill set to be shelved due to election
item.description: Rishi Sunak's flagship ban on smoking for people born after 2009 runs out of time to pass into law.

item.title: Army rejected teen over breast-cancer gene
item.description: The Army is accused of sexism after rejecting a teenager who may have a gene raising her risk of breast cancer.

item.title: Four dead and 16 injured in Majorca building collapse
item.description: Four people die and 21 are injured after a restaurant collapsed in Majorca, Spanish emergency services say.

item.title: 'He does special things every week' - Littler's rise continues
item.description: Teenager Luke Littler continues his rise with his first major PDC title, beating Luke Humphries in the Premier League Darts final.

item.title: 'Surgeon left a specimen bag inside me after hernia op'
item.description: Part of Tom Hadrys's bowel cut out during the operation was also left behind by the surgeon.

item.title: McCartney roasts Springsteen at Ivor Awards
item.description: The star mocks his friend, as he presents him with a prestigious lifetime achievement award.

item.title: Drivers trapped for hours in Edinburgh flooding
item.description: Edinburgh city bypass was closed in both directions after more than a month's worth of rain fell in 36 hours.

item.title: 'Bubbly girl', 10, died in mudslide on school trip
item.description: Leah Harrison was taking part in a "forest walk" during a residential trip when she was killed.

item.title: Boy died of sepsis after important GP note missed
item.description: A nine-year-old boy died from sepsis after doctors and nurses missed a "significant" GP note.

item.title: Sixteen arrested over Oxford University Gaza protest
item.description: Oxford Action for Palestine organised a sit-in at university offices on Wellington Square.

item.title: Sean Kingston's home raided after singer accused of not paying for huge TV
item.description: A company claims Sean Kingston did not fully pay for a 232-inch television and sound system.

item.title: First time voter? What you need to know
item.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has announced the next UK general election will take place on 4 July.

item.title: How Rishi Sunak sprang election surprise on Tories
item.description: Many Tories were blindsided by the PM's July election announcement - here is how the decision was made.

item.title: The events clashing with the UK's summer election
item.description: Politicians will vie for the attention of voters distracted by Euro 2024, Wimbledon and festivals.

item.title: Lib Dems pledge to hire 8,000 extra GPs if elected
item.description: Lib Dem leader Sir Ed Davey is calling for patients to have the right to see a GP within seven days.

item.title: Football regulator top transfer target for Labour
item.description: Labour sees the beautiful game as key to winning back areas like Scunthorpe from the Conservatives.

item.title: Tories 'terrified' of Reform Party - Richard Tice
item.description: The Reform Party leader says Rishi Sunak "bottled it" over calling a surprise general election for July.

item.title: Sunak attacks Welsh government on campaign visit
item.description: On a visit to Barry the PM attacks Labour on motorists and NHS, but runs into trouble on football.

item.title: Voters ‘distraught’ by direction of Conservatives - Greens
item.description: The Green Party of England and Wales co-leader Carla Denyer claims people are not inspired by Labour.

item.title: SNP say election date disrespectful to Scotland
item.description: The first minister criticised holding a UK election on the first week of Scotland's school holidays.

item.title: Election date brings Stormont battle lines into focus
item.description: Stormont's parties have long been preparing for this, but the date being confirmed will bring battle lines into focus.

item.title: Welsh parties hit the campaign trail
item.description: On a visit to Barry the PM attacks Labour on motorists and NHS, but runs into trouble on football.

item.title: People are crying out for change, says Davey
item.description: The Lib Dem leader says the Conservatives have taken people "for granted for so long".

item.title: NI parties gearing up for summer election
item.description: Some party leaders say they are surprised by an election in six weeks time, others say they have been waiting patiently.

item.title: Chris Mason: Why did Sunak call an election now?
item.description: An election has been called by Rishi Sunak sooner than many commentators and politicians had expected.

item.title: UK's future in your hands, Starmer tells voters
item.description: The Labour leader says the general election would be an opportunity to "change the country".

item.title: Election poll tracker: How do the parties compare?
item.description: How do people say they will vote in the UK general election? Our poll tracker measures the trends.

item.title: Voters ‘distraught’ by direction of Conservatives, say Greens
item.description: The Green Party of England and Wales co-leader Carla Denyer claims people are not inspired by Labour.

item.title: July election date disrespectful to Scotland, says SNP's Swinney
item.description: The first minister criticised holding a UK election on the first week of Scotland's school holidays.

item.title: Welsh battle lines drawn as general election called
item.description: Welsh parties make pitches to voters as Rishi Sunak kicks off general election campaign.

item.title: Scarlett Johansson's AI row has echoes of Silicon Valley's bad old days
item.description: A clash with the actor has echoes of the macho tech giants of the past, says Zoe Kleinman.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: What ICC arrest warrants mean for Israel and Hamas
item.description: The Israeli and Hamas leaders are suspected of committing war crimes during the continuing war in Gaza.

item.title: What next for Iran after President Raisi's death?
item.description: Raisi's death will test a system where hardliners dominate all branches of power, Lyse Doucet writes.

item.title: Taiwan's steely leader rewrote the book on how to deal with China
item.description: Taiwan's outgoing president says boosting her country's military was the only way to defy China's threat.

item.title: Weekly quiz: What North Korean song was banned after going viral?
item.description: Test how closely you have been paying attention to what has been going on over the past seven days.

item.title: TikTok trainspotter Francis Bourgeois: 'Passion is cool'
item.description: The star, fresh from a UK rail adventure for the BBC, talks identity, hate and saving the railway.

item.title: 'They leave boyfriends and girlfriends for war, and may never return'
item.description: A rebel teacher using music to drown the din of war in the jungle talks to the BBC's Quentin Sommerville.

item.title: Casement Park and the long road to Euro 2028
item.description: Here's all you need to know on the stadium-sized rows delaying a decade-long project.

item.title: 'I thought: He’s going to stab me, I’m going to die'
item.description: Seven years after making a poster warning about knife crime, Ethan's friend was stabbed to death.

item.title: Rosenberg: Putin's military purge echoes Prigozhin's call to act
item.description: Russia's president seems to be acting on the late Wagner chief's warnings, but in his own time.

item.title: Bank holiday weather: Rain or shine?
item.description: After yet more rain this week, can we expect something brighter for the long weekend?

item.title: Download now
item.description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

item.title: Pope clears way for London teen to become first millennial saint
item.description: Carlo Acutis, who was born in London, is set to become the first millennial to be canonised.

item.title: White horses and sunset swims: Africa's top shots
item.description: A selection of the best photos from across the African continent this week.

item.title: Diddy's violence left me broken, says Cassie
item.description: Footage emerged last week which showed rapper Diddy attacking the singer in 2016.

item.title: Farage rules out standing in general election
item.description: Reform leader Richard Tice says his party will contest 630 of the 650 seats up for grabs on 4 July.

item.title: Man charged with helping Russian intelligence in UK
item.description: Howard Michael Phillips, 64, was arrested in central London and is due in court on Thursday.

item.title: Boy shot in head with airgun while getting football
item.description: A boy's skull was fractured by a shot from an airgun as he climbed a fence to fetch his football.

item.title: Mother's joy as son named world's youngest male artist
item.description: The Ghanaian toddler broke the record at the tender age of one year and 152 days.

item.title: 'He does special things every week' - Littler's rise continues
item.description: Teenager Luke Littler continues his rise with his first major PDC title, beating Luke Humphries in the Premier League Darts final.

item.title: Unconvincing England win series opener against Pakistan
item.description: England comfortably beat Pakistan by 37 runs in the opening one-day international at Derby.

item.title: Maresca, McKenna & Frank on Chelsea job shortlist
item.description: Ipswich’s Kieran McKenna, Leicester's Enzo Maresca and Brentford’s Thomas Frank are on Chelsea's shortlist to replace Mauricio Pochettino.

item.title: New video shows arrest of golfer Scheffler at US PGA
item.description: Dash-cam footage shows World No. 1 golfer Scottie Scheffler arrested by Louisville Police.

item.title: Rooney to speak to Plymouth over managerial vacancy
item.description: Wayne Rooney is set to have talks with Championship side Plymouth Argyle about their vacant head coach role.

item.title: Ecclestone and Dean star as England beat Pakistan
item.description: Watch the best of England's spin bowling highlights as Sophie Ecclestone and Charlie Dean take 5 wickets between them in England's 37 run win over Pakistan in the first ODI at Derby.

item.description: Live Coverage of the General Election campaign for the 2024 election.

item.title: Hosting Euros 'could bring more than £100m to NI'
item.description: NI is due to host five matches at Casement Park in Belfast - but the stadium's future is uncertain.

item.title: How important is Scotland in deciding the UK election?
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer and Rishi Sunak are hoping this election marks the end of an era of SNP domination.

item.title: Head teacher becomes school caretaker to save cash
item.description: Schools like Gareth Lewis's are responding to a squeeze on budgets, while others are cutting jobs.
